intro: Aconogonon phytolaccifolium var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may spread aggressively if not managed properly.
